original: KLEINE, Edvard Johan Heinrich, Köpman, Malmö, f Hbg 1/10 90 av fabr A K o h h, f Petersen, gm Vera Thulin. Hbgs hal, hdls-skoleutbildn, stud inom tekn ind i Tyskl. Prakt inom skogshushålln, genomg Skogssko-lari, Kålleberga, Ljungbyhed, ex 12. Anst v Mmöh läns hush.sällsk ss konsult jägare 13 —14, repr f Bröd Boreus i Hbg 14—18, egen aff.verks i sportart, cykl o motorcykl i Hbg 18—23, olika anst 23—25, anst v Velociped AB Lindblads Mmöfil 25—35. Egen aff.verks und fma AB Kleines Motorsportaffär i Mmö sed. 35. Direkt imp av »DKW» motorcykl sed. 35 samt »Triumph» o sed. 39 »Harley Davidson» motorcykl. Medl SMK, styr.led där 21—35. Kört motorcykel sed. 10, tävl.för sed. 20 o erövr c :a 200 priser, bl a »Fägriltpokalen» 31 o vandr.pris »Skåne runt» 32. Hobbies: Jakt o fiske.
translated: KLEINE, Edvard Johan Heinrich, Merchant, Malmö, born in Helsingborg on October 1, 1890, son of factory owner A.K. and H.H., born Petersen, married to Vera Thulin. Completed half of the commercial school in Helsingborg, studied technical industry in Germany. Practical experience in forestry, completed forestry courses in Kålleberga and Ljungbyhed, graduated in 1912. Employed by the Malmö County Household Society as a consultant hunter from 1913 to 1914, representative for Bröd Boreus in Helsingborg from 1914 to 1918. Owned a business selling sporting goods, bicycles, and motorcycles in Helsingborg from 1918 to 1923, held various positions from 1923 to 1925, employed by Velociped AB Lindblads Malmö branch from 1925 to 1935. Started own business with the company AB Kleines Motorsportaffär in Malmö since 1935. Direct importer of "DKW" motorcycles since 1935, as well as "Triumph" and since 1939 "Harley Davidson" motorcycles. Member of the Swedish Motorcycle Club, served on the board from 1921 to 1935. Has been riding motorcycles since 1910, competed since 1920 and won over 200 prizes, including the "Fägril Trophy" in 1931 and the wandering prize "Skåne Runt" in 1932. Hobbies: Hunting and fishing.
